page.title: 14THE CANAL
page.content: The canal started in 1703 was intended to link Melton Mowbray with Oakham.It reached Oakham in 1802 and cost #70000 to build.All that remains now is a short stretch either side of the Langham to Burley Road,between the Ashwell to Oakham Road and the railway.It is used for coarse fishing by members of the Oakham Angling Society who maintain what is left of the canal.The fish caught are roach, perch and pike.The land around the canal is mostly cereals and grazing, the grazing mostly belonging to the Cottesmore Hunt Kennels at whose buildings the northern end of the canal terminates.The canal passes under the Langham to Burley Road about 30 metres from the railway line,which itself passes over the same road by means of a level crossing.The railway is the Birmingham-East Coast line.
